Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that "some government agencies" have labeled the Family Research Council as a terrorist group, when in fact, no government agencies have done so.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that the Southern Poverty Law Center, a prominent civil rights group, has labeled the Family Research Council as an "extremist group."
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to substantiate the assertion that "some government agencies" have labeled the Family Research Council as a terrorist group.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Southern Poverty Law Center's classification of the Family Research Council as an "extremist group" is equivalent to being labeled a terrorist group by government agencies, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that Carson may have been referring to the Southern Poverty Law Center's classification of the Family Research Council as an "extremist group" rather than government agencies labeling them as a terrorist group.
